Package portfolios

Interface StockPortfolio

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BetterStockPortfolio
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdvancedStockPortfolio, SimpleStockPortfolio
    public interface StockPortfolio
    The portfolios.StockPortfolio interface represent operations on a portfolio of stocks, allowing for the addition and removal of stocks as well as the calculation of total value on a given day.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void adjustStock​(java.lang.String ticker, double shares)
      The adjustStock method adds or removes the specified number of shares of a given stock to the portfolio.
      java.lang.String getName()
      The getName method returns the name of a portfolio.
      java.util.List<Stock> getStocks()
      The getStocks method returns the list of Stocks currently in the portfolio.
      double getValue​(java.time.LocalDate date)
      The getValue method return the value of the entire portfolio on a given date based on the closing price of the stocks.
      java.lang.String listStocks()
      The listStocks method lists all the stocks in the current portfolio and the number of share of each.
      void setName​(java.lang.String name)
      The setName method allows a user to name their portfolio.

    • Method Detail

      • adjustStock

        void adjustStock​(java.lang.String ticker,
                 double shares)
        The adjustStock method adds or removes the specified number of shares of a given stock to the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        ticker - the stock ticker
        shares - the number of shares

      • setName

        void setName​(java.lang.String name)
        The setName method allows a user to name their portfolio.
        Parameters:
        name - the desired name

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        The getName method returns the name of a portfolio.
        Returns:
        the name

      • getValue

        double getValue​(java.time.LocalDate date)
        The getValue method return the value of the entire portfolio on a given date based on the closing price of the stocks.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to determine value
        Returns:
        the total value of the portfolio

      • listStocks

        java.lang.String listStocks()
        The listStocks method lists all the stocks in the current portfolio and the number of share of each.
        Returns:
        a list of stocks as a string

      • getStocks

        java.util.List<Stock> getStocks()
        The getStocks method returns the list of Stocks currently in the portfolio.
        Returns:
        a list of Stock objects
